hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu al-Yausr: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: 'Whoever gives respite to an insolvent debtor or forgives him, Allah will shade him on the Day when there is no shade except His shade.'

narrators.name: Yaqub ibn Humaid
narrators.full_name: Yaqub ibn Humaid ibn Muhammad al-Razi
reliabilityIssues: questioned by some scholars for precision

narrators.name: Ubadah ibn al-Walid
narrators.full_name: Ubadah ibn al-Walid ibn Ubadah al-Madani

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Multiple indirect transmission terms (عَنْ) from Abu Harzah onwards
Abu Harzah is majhul al-hal and uses عَنْ transmission
Ubadah ibn al-Walid uses عَنْ instead of direct transmission terms

potential_issues.issue: Abu Harzah (Yaqub ibn Mujahid) has unknown reliability status (Majhul al-Hal)
potential_issues.impact: As the first narrator using indirect transmission (عَنْ), this weakens the chain slightly. A narrator of unknown reliability with indirect transmission raises concerns about the connection's authenticity.

potential_issues.issue: Multiple use of عَنْ (indirect transmission) in succession
potential_issues.impact: From Abu Harzah onwards, all transmission is via عَنْ without direct transmission terms. While the intermediate narrators are acceptable, the lack of direct transmission terminology creates potential for disconnection.

potential_issues.issue: Yaqub ibn Humaid is only Saduq, not a high-grade narrator
potential_issues.impact: While acceptable, his limited precision combined with the weak links below creates a chain that is acceptable but not strong.

Topics: Giving respite to an insolvent debtor
Forgiving debts
Shade on the Day of Judgment
Divine reward for mercy to debtors

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu al-Yausr: I bear witness upon the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, indeed I heard him saying: 'Verily, the first of people to be shaded in the shade of Allah on the Day of Judgment is a man who gave respite to an insolvent debtor until he found something, or gave charity to him for what he demanded, saying: my obligation upon you is charity, seeking the Face of Allah the Mighty and Majestic, and he tore up his debt-note.'

narrators.name: Kamil ibn Talhah
narrators.full_name: Kamil ibn Talhah ibn Muhammad al-Baahili

narrators.name: Ibn Lahia
narrators.full_name: Abdul-Jabbar ibn Muhammad ibn Abdul-Rahman ibn Zaid ibn al-Khattab
reliabilityIssues: memory became weaker in later life

narrators.name: Abu Yunus
narrators.full_name: Khalid ibn Yazid ibn Ziyad al-Kaisani

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Kamil ibn Talhah is declared Very Weak (Da'if Jiddan) - critical issue
Ibn Lahia is known for mistakes (Saduq Lahu Awham)
Use of أَنَّ (that) from Abu al-Yausr indicates potential disconnection

potential_issues.issue: Kamil ibn Talhah is classified as Da'if Jiddan (Very Weak)
potential_issues.impact: This is a critical weakness. A very weak narrator at the beginning of the chain significantly damages the hadith's reliability. Kamil ibn Talhah's weakness is a major concern.

potential_issues.issue: Ibn Lahia (Abdul-Jabbar ibn Muhammad) is Saduq Lahu Awham - known for having many mistakes
potential_issues.impact: Combined with the weakness of Kamil ibn Talhah, this creates a problematic chain. Ibn Lahia's known errors further weaken transmission reliability.

potential_issues.issue: Transmission from Abu al-Yausr uses أَنَّ (that) instead of direct terms
potential_issues.impact: The use of أَنَّ creates ambiguity and suggests possible disconnection in the chain at this point.

Topics: First people shaded in God's shade on Day of Judgment
Merit of giving respite to insolvent debtor
Charity and debt forgiveness
Tearing up debt records

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu al-Yausr: The Prophet ﷺ used to say: 'O Allah, I seek refuge in You from collapse, falling down, senility, drowning, burning, and I seek refuge in You lest Satan should possess me at the time of death, and I seek refuge in You lest I be killed in Your way turned back (in retreat), or that I die bitten by a poisonous creature.'

narrators.name: Yaqub ibn Humaid
narrators.full_name: Yaqub ibn Humaid ibn Muhammad al-Razi
reliabilityIssues: questioned by some scholars for precision

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Abu Hind is Majhul - completely unknown narrator
Sayfiyy is Majhul al-Hal with unknown reliability

potential_issues.issue: Abu Hind is Majhul (completely unknown) - major reliability issue
potential_issues.impact: An unknown narrator in the middle of the chain is a critical weakness. This creates significant doubt about the transmission's authenticity as we cannot assess Abu Hind's reliability.

potential_issues.issue: Sayfiyy has unknown reliability status (Majhul al-Hal)
potential_issues.impact: Another unknown narrator creates cumulative weakness. When coupled with Abu Hind's unknown status, this severely damages the chain.

potential_issues.issue: Multiple indirect transmissions (عَنْ) from Abdullah ibn Said onwards

potential_issues.issue: Yaqub ibn Humaid is only Saduq, not highly reliable
potential_issues.impact: The opening narrator's limited reliability, combined with the weak middle narrators, creates an overall weak chain.

Topics: Supplication seeking refuge from Allah

Protection from senility and drowning

hadiths.english_translation: His kunya is Abu Muhammad. He was killed (martyred) on the Day of Yamama. This occurred in the year twelve (of Hijra). He was a Badri (one of the companions who participated in the Battle of Badr) - may Allah be pleased with him.

potential_issues.issue: This is biographical information about a companion, not a hadith with an isnad chain
potential_issues.impact: There is no chain of transmission to evaluate. This is historical/biographical information about Thabit ibn Qays from the collector's notes, not a narrated hadith.

Topics: Praise of Companion Thabit ibn Qays by the Prophet ﷺ

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by the daughter of Thabit ibn Qays ibn Shammash: When Allah revealed to His Messenger ﷺ 'Verily Allah does not like every arrogant, boastful person', this verse affected Thabit greatly, he closed his door and began to weep. The Messenger ﷺ was informed and sent for him, and Thabit complained about this. He said: I am a man who loves beauty and wants to lead my people. The Prophet ﷺ said: You are not among them, rather you will live in goodness, die in goodness, and Allah will enter you into Paradise. When Allah revealed 'O you who believe, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet' and 'O you who believe, raise not your voices in the presence of Allah's Messenger', Thabit was affected similarly because his voice was loud, and he feared his deeds would be nullified. The Prophet ﷺ said again: You are not among them, you will live in goodness and be killed as a martyr, and Allah will enter you into Paradise. When Abu Bakr called the Muslims to fight the apostates and the people of Yamama and Musaylimah the Liar, Thabit ibn Qays marched with them. When they met Musaylimah and Bani Hanifa, the Muslims were defeated three times. Thabit ibn Qays and Salim, the freed slave of Abu Hudhayfa, said: We did not fight this way with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. They dug a pit for themselves, entered it, and fought until they were killed. A Muslim man saw Thabit ibn Qays in a dream and Thabit said: When I was killed yesterday, a Muslim man took a precious suit of armor from me, his dwelling is at the end of the camp, and at his dwelling is a horse tied up, and he covered the armor with a cooking pot and placed a saddle over the pot. Tell Khalid to send someone to get my armor, for when you come to the Caliph of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, inform him that I have such and such debt and such and such wealth, and such and such slave of mine is free, and beware lest you say this is a dream and waste it. So he went to Khalid and sent for the armor and found it as described. He came to Abu Bakr and informed him, so Abu Bakr fulfilled his will, and it is not known that anyone's will was fulfilled after his death except that of Thabit ibn Qays.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Anas: On the day of Yamama, people were routed. Anas said: I came to Thabit ibn Qays and found him with his thighs exposed, preparing for burial (with perfume). I said: Uncle, what prevents you from joining us? What kept you back? He said: I am a loud-voiced man and I fear my deeds have been nullified.

hadiths.english_translation: Abu Burdah Hani ibn Niyar ibn Amr ibn Ubayd ibn Kilab ibn Ghanim ibn Hubayra ibn Dahl ibn Hani ibn Bali ibn Amr ibn al-Lahaf ibn Qudaa' (genealogy of Abu Burdah)

hadiths.english_translation: From the tribe of Bali, allied to Bani Harithah ibn al-Harith ibn al-Khazraj ibn Amr ibn Malik ibn al-Aus ibn Harith ibn Tha'labah ibn Amr ibn Amir - Badri and Aqabi (one who took the second oath at al-Aqaba) - may Allah be pleased with him. Narrated by Muhammad ibn Ubaid ibn Hisab: We are informed by Hammad ibn Zaid from Yahya ibn Said from Abdullah ibn Abi al-Mughirah from Abu Burdah ibn Niyar - may Allah be pleased with him...

hadiths.english_translation: Hadith: قَالَ : سَمِعْتُ عِتْبَانَ بْنَ مَالِكٍ الأَنْصَارِيَّ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ ثُمَّ أَحَدَ بَنِي سَالِمٍ ، يَقُولُ : كُنْتُ أُصَلِّي لِقَوْمِي بَنِي سَالِمٍ ، فَأَتَيْتُ النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ ، فَقُلْتُ : " إِنِّي قَدْ أَنْكَرْتُ بَصَرِي ، وَإِنَّ السُّيُولَ تَحُولُ بَيْنِي وَب

hadiths.english_translation: Hadith: حَدَّثَنَا شَيْبَانُ بْنُ فَرُّوخٍ ، نا سُلَيْمَانُ بْنُ الْمُغِيرَةِ ، عَنْ ثَابِتٍ الْبُنَانِيِّ ، عَنْ أَنَسِ بْنِ مَالِكٍ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ ، قَالَ : وَحَدَّثَنِي مَحْمُودُ بْنُ الرَّبِيعِ ، عَنْ عِتْبَانَ بْنِ مَالِكٍ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ ، قَالَ : قَدِمْتُ الْمَدِينَةَ فَلَقِيتُ عِتْبَانَ

Topics: Topic from hadith

hadiths.english_translation: Hadith: حَدَّثَنَا يَعْقُوبُ بْنُ حُمَيْدٍ ، نا عَبْدُ الْعَزِيزِ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُمَرَ ، عَنْ بَشِيرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ زَيْدِ بْنِ رَبِّ الْكَعْبَةِ الأَنْصَارِيِّ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ وَهُوَ الَّذِي أُرِيَ النِّدَاءَ أَنَّهُ تَصَدَّقَ بِمَالِهِ وَلَمْ

potential_issues.issue: Biographical/genealogical information without hadith chain

hadiths.english_translation: Biographical information about a companion: أَحَدُ بَنِي أُمَيَّةَ بْنِ زَيْدِ يُكَنَّى أَبَا عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ مَاتَ وَهُوَ ابْنُ خَمْسٍ وَسِتِّينَ فِي خِلافَةِ عُمَرَ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ بَدْرِيٌّ . 1728

potential_issues.issue: Biographical/genealogical information without hadith chain
